answers.answer: Hi there.The symptoms and character of the pain that you have described may be neuropathic in nature.  Neuropathic pain can indeed be caused by stress especially if all your work-ups turn out normal.  Other possible causes includes micronutrient deficiency such as deficiency in the B vitamins (B1, B6, B12).  Metabolic conditions such as diabetes can also present with this kind of symptoms.  I suggest that you relax and avoid stress as much as possible (though this may sound easier said than done) and have a balanced diet with possible supplementation of vitamins and minerals.Regards.

question: I have tingling, numbness in both arms and feet, including toes and fingers.Sometimes the tingling turns into pain.Took blood work- everything normalDoctor said could be stress relatedThis has been constant for two monthsWhat could it be?
title: tingling in both hands and legs
